metadata.Title: CVE-2023-28320 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: A denial of service vulnerability exists in curl <v8.1.0 in the way libcurl provides several different backends for resolving host names, selected at build time. If it is built to use the synchronous resolver, it allows name resolves to time-out slow operations using `alarm()` and `siglongjmp()`. When doing this, libcurl used a global buffer that was not mutex protected and a multi-threaded application might therefore crash or otherwise misbehave.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> Ubuntu is not vulnerable to this issue as packages are built with the threaded resolver, not the synchronous resolver.

criterions.comment: curl: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
